suggestions.action: [US-054, US-055, US-056] Consider adding explicit test cases for RALPH_MAX_REVIEW_ATTEMPTS retry behavior mentioned in FR-12
[US-022] Could include test for checking both CLIs missing scenario

taskGroupings.reason: Both are pure TypeScript type definitions with no implementation logic, same domain (spec review types)
Both are configuration-related changes - default CLI setting and timeout configuration
Both are prompt template definitions with no implementation logic, related purpose (review prompts)
Both are simple CLI wiring - parent command registration and exit code handling
Both are isolated, simple additions - loop limit calculation and sidebar navigation item

standaloneTasks.reason: Complex analysis logic for god spec detection with multiple indicator checks and estimation algorithms
Core orchestration logic that integrates multiple modules (prompts, codebase context, aggregator) with CLI spawning
Separate review runner mode with different tool access requirements - risk of confusion with US-013
Complex feedback handling with agent context updates and preference learning - high integration risk
Complex Lexical editor integration requiring deep understanding of AST manipulation and DOM operations
Complex diff view utilities requiring MDXEditor plugin integration and state management
Full diff approval flow wiring multiple components together - high integration complexity
Split preview and save flow with multiple file operations and session updates - high risk if combined
End-to-end integration test requiring full CLI flow verification
End-to-end integration test for god spec detection requiring complex test setup
End-to-end integration test for dashboard requiring browser/component testing infrastructure
